<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Represents the cost of inlining a function.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This supports special values for functions which should &quot;always&quot; or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &quot;never&quot; be inlined. Otherwise, the cost represents a unitless amount;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">/// smaller values increase the likelihood of the function being inlined.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Objects of this type also provide the adjusted threshold for inlining</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">/// based on the information available for a particular callsite. They can be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">/// directly tested to determine if inlining should occur given the cost and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">/// threshold for this cost metric.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/inlinecost"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">InlineCost &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SentinelValues &#123; AlwaysInlineCost = INT&#95;MIN, NeverInlineCost = INT&#95;MAX &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The estimated cost of inlining this callsite.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Thresholds to tune inline cost analysis. The inline cost analysis decides</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the condition to apply a threshold and applies it. Otherwise,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="comment">/// DefaultThreshold is used. If a threshold is Optional, it is applied only</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="comment">/// when it has a valid value. Typically, users of inline cost analysis</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="comment">/// obtain an InlineParams object through one of the \\c getInlineParams methods</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and pass it to \\c getInlineCost. Some specialized versions of inliner</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (such as the pre-inliner) might have custom logic to compute \\c InlineParams</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="comment">/// object.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note that a default threshold is passed into this function. This threshold</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Get the cost estimate ignoring thresholds. This is similar to getInlineCost</Highlight></CodeLine>
